name: Behavior Driven Development (BDD)
description:
Sub Category: Methodology
Placement Reason: Growing across IT industry. BDD offers more precise guidance on organizing the conversation between developers, testers and domain experts
Description: Behavior-driven development (BDD) is an Agile software development methodology in which an application is documented and designed around the behavior a user expects to experience when interacting with it

name: Test Driven Development (TDD)
description:
Sub Category: Methodology
Placement Reason: To write simple and just enough code. Provides quick Feedback. Standard development practice.
Description: Test-driven development (TDD) is a software development process relying on software requirements being converted to test cases before software is fully developed

name: Unit Testing
description:
Sub Category: Testing
Placement Reason: Best practice verify code functionality as atomic as possible and automated
Description: A unit test exercises the smallest piece of testable software in the application to determine whether it behaves as expected

name: Integration Testing
description:
Sub Category: Testing
Placement Reason: Best practice to verify the integration of microservices
Description: An integration test verifies the communication paths and interactions between components to detect interface defects

name: Component Testing
description:
Sub Category: Testing
Placement Reason: A component test limits the scope of the exercised software to a portion of the system under test, manipulating the system through internal code interfaces and using test doubles to isolate the code under test from other components.
Description: A component test limits the scope of the exercised software to a portion of the system under test, manipulating the system through internal code interfaces and using test doubles to isolate the code under test from other components

name: Consumer Driven Contract Testing
description:
Sub Category: Testing
Placement Reason: An integration contract test is a test at the boundary of an external service verifying that it meets the contract expected by a consuming service.
Description: An integration contract test is a test at the boundary of an external service verifying that it meets the contract expected by a consuming service

name: End-To-End Testing
description:
Sub Category: Testing
Placement Reason: Test Level in projects.
Description: An end-to-end test verifies that a system meets external requirements and achieves its goals, testing the entire system, from end to end

name: Chaos Testing
description: Chaos testing is a technique for testing software systems that are under the influence of external forces, such as external events, such as a network outage, or external processes, such as a process crash

name: Load- and Performance-Testing
description: Load and performance testing is the process of putting demand on a system and measuring its response

name: Screenplay Pattern
description: The Screenplay Pattern is a user-centric model with users and external systems interacting with the system under test represented as actors

name: Page Object Model
description: Page Object Model, also known as POM, is a design pattern that creates an object repository for storing all web elements

name: Agile
description: Agile software development is more than frameworks such as Scrum, Extreme Programming, or Feature-Driven Development (FDD). https://www.agilealliance.org/agile101/

name: Scrum
description: Scrum is a lightweight framework that helps people, teams and organizations generate value through adaptive solutions for complex problems

name: Kanban
description: Kanban Board is a visual representation of the Agile task boards

name: DevOps
description: DevOps is a culture that enables formerly siloed rolesâ€”development, IT operations, quality engineering, and security to coordinate and collaborate to produce better, more reliable products

name: Kotlin
description: Kotlin is a multiplatform, statically typed, general-purpose programming language

name: Java
description: Java is a multi-platform, object-oriented, and network-centric language

name: Python
description: Python is an interpreted, object-oriented, high-level programming language with dynamic semantics

name: C#
description: C# is a modern, object-oriented, and type-safe programming language

name: TypeScript
description: TypeScript a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript and adds optional static typing to the language

name: JavaScript
description: JavaScript is a dynamic computer programming language

name: GoLang
description: Go is an open source programming language used for general purpose

name: Scala
description: Scala is a modern multi-paradigm programming language designed to express common programming patterns in a concise, elegant, and type-safe way

name: AWS Lambda
description: AWS Lambda is an event-driven computing cloud service from Amazon Web Services that allows developers to program functions on a pay-per-use basis without having to provision storage or compute resources to support them

name: AWS Aurora
description: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database built for the cloud

name: AWS DynamoDB
description: Amazon DynamoDB is a fast and flexible NoSQL database service for all applications that need consistent, single-digit millisecond latency

name: Microsoft Azure
description: Microsoft Azure is Microsoft's public cloud computing platform

name: Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
description: Google Cloud Platform is a suite of public cloud computing services offered by Google

name: Playwright
description: Browser Automation Framework

name: 7Facette
description: Kotlin Mutliplatform Test Automation Library

name: Selenium
description: Selenium is a web automation framework for testing web applications

name: Appium
description: Appium is a mobile automation framework for testing mobile applications

name: Cypress
description: Cypress is a JavaScript testing framework for testing web applications

name: Jest
description: Jest is a JavaScript testing framework for testing web applications

name: Mocha
description: Mocha is a JavaScript testing framework for testing web applications

description: Nightwatch is a JavaScript testing framework for testing web applications

name: Gatling
description: Gatling is a load testing framework for testing web applications

name: JUnit5
description: JUnit is one of the most popular unit-testing frameworks in the Java ecosystem

name: Cucumber
description: Cucumber is a software tool that supports behavior-driven development (BDD)

name: Maven
description: Java build and dependency management tool using a 'Convention over configuration'-approach

name: Gradle
description: Gradle is a build automation tool for multi-language software development

name: pyTest
description: PyTest is a testing framework that allows users to write test codes using Python programming language

name: React
description: Java script library for building Front end applications. https://reactjs.org/

name: SBT
description: Scala build tool

description: The Spring Framework is an application framework and inversion of control container for the Java platform
